strings:
<center>‘My name is Egeus.
<center>There was once a time when people
<center>would call me the Child of the Goddess.

<center>‘But I have come to realise that I am a mere
<center>human child, weak and delicate like any other.

<center>‘After the Lord of Darkness was sealed away,
<center>I sacrificed my life that others might live.

<center>‘Here I record my final prophecy.
<center>I pray that it will be seen by
<center>the eyes of the righteous.

<center>‘As I gaze into the future,
<center>I foresee a period of darkness;
<center>a time that is shrouded in mist.

<center>‘A time when the Lord of Darkness,
<center>Rhapthorne, may once again terrorise the world.

<center>‘But we should not lose heart,
<center>for our bloodlines will still live on.

<center>‘When the time comes...
<center>There will be a living heir for each of us.

<center>‘The heir of the great warrior, Golding,
<center>will be living with his two adopted children,
<center>surrounded by the voices of joyous people.

<center>‘The heir of the sorcerer, Master Gozo,
<center>will be carrying on the tradition,
<center>teaching magic in a town near the castle
<center>where the sceptre is sealed away.

<center>‘The heir of the great magician, Kupas,
<center>will be living with monsters deep in the forest,
<center>having abandoned his life of magic.

<center>‘The bloodline of the magical swordsman,
<center>Alexander, will be transferred to
<center>another family, and his heir will
<center>be renowned across the land.

<center>‘The heir of the great scholar, Kadan,
<center>will be living an honest life
<center>deep in the snowy mountains,
<center>preserving the legend of the Godbird.

<center>‘The heir of Regnar, who returned
<center>to the world of men from heaven,
<center>will be the keeper of the faith
<center>for countless souls.

<center>‘And finally...my own heir will be living
<center>a contented life as the leader
<center>of a group of many monks.

<center>‘As long as at least one of them is alive,
<center>this world shall be safe for all eternity.

<center>‘As such it is imperative that their lives
<center>are protected, lest the Lord of Darkness ever
<center>return to extinguish the light of this world.

<center>‘It is the only way.
<center>I pray to the Goddess that our children
<center>will abide by these words.’
